medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her normal state of health until 4 days ago when she experienced band-like pain across her upper abdomen after consuming a fatty meal. The pain radiated down towards her lower quadrants and felt like 'reflux pain.' It was alleviated by toradol received in the ED. The patient has tolerated non-fatty foods during the week and denied nausea, emesis, diarrhea, changes in stool or urine, and dysuria. She noted subjective fevers for the past few days without chills, and mentioned no bowel movement for 3 days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Rectal cancer adenocarcinoma, stage I, s/p low anterior resection and anastamosis; history of small bowel obstructions (SBO) managed conservatively; stricture found at ~50cm on flex sig; head injury at age leading to unsteadiness; bilateral rotator cuff injuries; obstructive sleep apnea (OSA); hypertension; gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD); asthma; osteopenia; arthritis; migraines; urinary retention s/p bladder sling surgery; vaginal hysterectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Sister died of colon cancer; paternal grandfather died of gastric cancer; aunt and father had multivascular dementia.
